com.st.st25sdk.command

Interface Type5CommandInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    NdefType5Command, Type5Command

    public interface Type5CommandInterface
    This class consists exclusively of methods that map the NFC Forum Type 5 Tag RF commands.

    All methods (at the exception of select) use a block address as parameter. The first block of memory starts at address 0. The number of bytes per block can be determined by the length of the response of readSingleBlock (without BSS) minus 1 byte (for the response flag) when the command is successful.

    All commands return a status flag in the first byte of their response. The content of this response flag is described in the Type 5 specification. When a command is successful, the flag value is 0x00.

    The methods of this class all throw a STException returned by the RF transceive() command implemented for each reader.

    • Method Detail

      • readSingleBlock

        byte[] readSingleBlock(byte blockAddress,
                       byte flag,
                       byte[] uid)
                throws STException
        Read Single Block command as defined in NFC Forum Type 5 specification. Reads the content of one memory block (command code 0x20).
        Parameters:
        blockAddress - Address of the block to read
        flag - Request flag for the command
        uid - Tag's UID (used only if the Select or Addressed mode bits are set in the flag)
        Returns:
        array of bytes = 1 byte response flag + the content of the block (Little endian, or LSByte first)
        Throws:
        STException

      • writeSingleBlock

        byte writeSingleBlock(byte blockAddress,
                      byte[] buffer,
                      byte flag,
                      byte[] uid)
               throws STException
        Write Single Block command as defined in NFC Forum Type 5 specification. Updates the content of one memory block (command code 0x21).
        Parameters:
        blockAddress - Address of the block to write
        buffer - Data to write (Little endian, or LSByte first)
        flag - Request flag for the command
        uid - Tag's UID (used only if the Select or Addressed mode bits are set in the flag)
        Returns:
        1 byte response for status
        Throws:
        STException

      • lockSingleBlock

        byte lockSingleBlock(byte blockAddress,
                     byte flag,
                     byte[] uid)
              throws STException
        Lock Single Block command as defined in NFC Forum Type 5 specification. Locks the content of one memory block (command code 0x22).
        Parameters:
        blockAddress - Address of the block to lock
        flag - Request flag for the command
        uid - Tag's UID (used only if the Select or Addressed mode bits are set in the flag)
        Returns:
        1 byte response for status
        Throws:
        STException

      • readMultipleBlock

        byte[] readMultipleBlock(byte blockAddress,
                         byte numberOfBlocks,
                         byte flag,
                         byte[] uid)
                  throws STException
        Read Multiple Block command as defined in NFC Forum Type 5 specification. Read the content of one or more memory blocks (command code 0x23).
        Parameters:
        blockAddress - Address of the first block to read
        numberOfBlocks - The number of blocks in the request is one less than the number of blocks that the VICC shall return in its response.
        flag - Request flag for the command
        uid - Tag's UID (used only if the Select or Addressed mode bits are set in the flag)
        Returns:
        array of bytes = 1 byte response flag + the content of the selected block (Little endian, or LSByte first)
        Throws:
        STException

      • extendedReadSingleBlock

        byte[] extendedReadSingleBlock(byte[] blockAddress,
                               byte flag,
                               byte[] uid)
                        throws STException
        Extended Read Single Block command as defined in NFC Forum Type 5 specification. Read the content of one block in an Extended memory (command code 0x30).
        Parameters:
        blockAddress - Address of the block to read (2-byte address, LSByte first)
        flag - Request flag for the command
        uid - Tag's UID (used only if the Select or Addressed mode bits are set in the flag)
        Returns:
        array of bytes = 1 byte response flag + the content of the selected block (Little endian, or LSByte first)
        Throws:
        STException

      • extendedWriteSingleBlock

        byte extendedWriteSingleBlock(byte[] blockAddress,
                              byte[] buffer,
                              byte flag,
                              byte[] uid)
                       throws STException
        Extended Write Single Block command as defined in NFC Forum Type 5 specification. Update the content of one block in an Extended memory (command code 0x31).
        Parameters:
        blockAddress - Address of the block to write (2-byte address, LSByte first)
        buffer - data to write (Little endian, or LSByte first)
        flag - Request flag for the command
        uid - Tag's UID (used only if the Select or Addressed mode bits are set in the flag)
        Returns:
        1 byte response for status
        Throws:
        STException

      • extendedLockSingleBlock

        byte extendedLockSingleBlock(byte[] blockAddress,
                             byte flag,
                             byte[] uid)
                      throws STException
        Extended Lock Single Block command as defined in NFC Forum Type 5 specification. Lock the content of one block in an Extended memory (command code 0x32).
        Parameters:
        blockAddress - Address of the block to lock (2-byte address)
        flag - Request flag for the command
        uid - Tag's UID (used only if the Select or Addressed mode bits are set in the flag)
        Returns:
        1 byte response for status
        Throws:
        STException

      • extendedReadMultipleBlock

        byte[] extendedReadMultipleBlock(byte[] blockAddress,
                                 byte[] numberOfBlocks,
                                 byte flag,
                                 byte[] uid)
                          throws STException
        Extended Read Multiple Block command as defined in NFC Forum Type 5 specification. Read the content of one or more blocks in an Extended memory (command code 0x33).
        Parameters:
        blockAddress - Address of the first block to read (2-byte address, LSByte first)
        flag - Request flag for the command
        uid - Tag's UID (used only if the Select or Addressed mode bits are set in the flag)
        Returns:
        array of bytes = 1 byte response flag + the content of the selected blocks (Little endian, or LSByte first)
        Throws:
        STException

      • select

        byte select(byte flag,
            byte[] uid)
     throws STException
        Select command as defined in NFC Forum Type 5 specification. Sets one Type 5 Tag into the Selected state (command code 0x25).
        Parameters:
        flag - Request flag for the command
        uid - Tag's UID (used only if the Select or Addressed mode bits are set in the flag)
        Returns:
        1 byte response for status
        Throws:
        STException

      • stayQuiet

        byte stayQuiet(byte flag,
               byte[] uid)
        throws STException
        SLPV_REQ command as defined in NFC Forum Type 5 specification. Sets one Type 5 Tag into the QUIET state (command code 0x02).
        Parameters:
        flag - Request flag for the command
        uid - Tag's UID (used only if the Select or Addressed mode bits are set in the flag)
        Returns:
        1 byte response for status
        Throws:
        STException
